item.description: Reuters - Microsoft Corp. said on Tuesday that it is reshuffling its Windows business and creating a new group that would dedicate itself to developing Windows, the world's largest software maker's core operating system.
item.title: Microsoft Revamps for Next Major Windows Release (Reuters)

item.description: Reuters - Philips Electronics (PHG.AS)(PHG.N) said on Tuesday it was six months away from launching a system against illegal copying that will allow consumers to play digital video and music on any digital media player.
item.title: Philips Will Launch Open Digital Media System Soon (Reuters)

item.description: Reuters - Imagine a future where a cell phone serves as a key to open doors, an identification card and an electronic wallet to buy everything from plane tickets to a compact disc or a can of soda.
item.title: Japan's DoCoMo Trials Ultra-Handy Smart-Chip Phone (Reuters)

item.description: Reuters - Banking officials and computer security experts predicted on Monday the wave of cyber scams targeting the financial services sector will soar in 2004 as the industry braces for a new onslaught of fraud schemes.
item.title: Finance Sector Bracing for Upswing in Net Fraud (Reuters)

item.description: Reuters - The camera cell phone, one of the hottest items on this year's Christmas gift list, is a growing privacy issue for both consumers and organizations.
item.title: Camera Phone Bans Seen as Aiding Privacy (Reuters)

item.description: AFP - Iraqis maintaining weblogs, or online diaries, offering vivid and often irreverent chronicles of life in the war-torn country have hailed the capture of Saddam Hussein, mocking his appearance but warning that there would be no swift justice.
item.title: Iraqi bloggers hail capture of "Saddam the monster" (AFP)

item.description: USATODAY.com - Seabiscuit races onto DVD Tuesday, but to get all the historical extras devoted to the fabled thoroughbred, you have to pony up extra.
item.title: 'Seabiscuit' jockeys for position (USATODAY.com)

item.description: Reuters - Sprint (FON.N)(PCS.N) said on Monday it would take fourth-quarter charges of about $365 million for job cuts and ditching a billing system, but it backed full-year targets for its wireline business and said wireless targets could hit the better end of its target range.
item.title: Sprint Sees $365 Million Charges (Reuters)

item.description: USATODAY.com - Computer retail giant CompUSA has begun offering an ATM-like service that dispenses software like candy from a vending machine.
item.title: Kiosk changes how software gets sold (USATODAY.com)

item.description: USATODAY.com - Who's afraid of retail giant Wal-Mart? Not Apple Computer (AAPL) CEO Steve Jobs.
item.title: Apple blasé about online music rivals (USATODAY.com)

item.description: Reuters - Motorola Inc. (MOT.N) on Tuesday officially ended three generations of leadership under the founding Galvin family, naming former Sun Microsystems Inc. (SUNW.O) President Edward Zander as its chairman and chief executive.
item.title: Ex-Sun Exec to Be Motorola Chairman-CEO (Reuters)

item.description: NewsFactor - Open-source can be faster, better and cheaper than closed corporate software development, say researchers at the University of California, Irvine (UCI) and the National Science Foundation.
item.title: Scientific Research Backs Wisdom of Open Source (NewsFactor)
